byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and KATE TAYLOR
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Cara Buckley, Rob Harris and Colin Moynihan.

abstract: Owners of Zuccotti Park ask New York City Mayor Michael M Bloomberg's office to cancel a planned cleaning of the park, which Occupy Wall Street protesters and their sympathizers had viewed as an attempt to evict them; the abrupt reversal is cheered by the demonstrators and seems to give the unfolding protests an air of credibility and endurance.
snippet: The abrupt reversal of plans to empty Zuccotti Park averted a clash at the southern tip of Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: The abrupt reversal of plans to empty Zuccotti Park averted a clash at the southern tip of Manhattan.

headline.main: Calls Flood In, City Backs Off and Protesters Stay
headline.print_headline: Calls Flood In; City Backs Off; Protesters Stay
headline.seo: Occupy Wall Street Protesters Remain in Zuccotti Park as Cleanup Is Canceled
